text: Hi Everyone, hoping to see if anyone else has run into this before. I have a custom card that is working correctly, However the card is under contacts right now, and when I make the adjustment to move it over to deals, I get an error. I also tested using an example from the git repo that displays on deals, and I am getting the same error. I'm not having much luck fixing this thus far, if anyone has any ideas I'd appreciate it greatly!
I've also just updated the cli and it persists unfortunately.
Can you share what’s in the json?
Hmm.. Can’t see anything wrong… might have to talk with support.

It's a bit of a head scratcher that's for sure. It's odd too because the example is erroring on upload without any changes either. It's going into a free account, but I don't believe there are any restrictions there.

> It's going into a free account, but I don't believe there are any restrictions there.
This beta is only enabled for Sales/Service hub enterprise. Can you DM me your account id?
ah yes indeed Sejal!
I see it's a test account, Matthew. This beta is not available on developer test accounts.
Ok what level does the account need to be at for me to be able to test in the account?
It needs to be Sales or Service Hub enterprise
Understood, thank you for clarifying!
Maybe we could get an error message that alerts when the account is not enabled... Might help with this recurring issue...

Hey all, we are creating records including notes from a react card. The issue Im seeing is that I cannot set the "hs_created_by" field for a note. It would be a great addition is we could bypass that rule when calling serverless functions from a crm card. We currentl hve no way to define the creator of objects :disappointed:
Might there be another way around this? If not I feel that this is a big miss for data integrity
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> thoughts?
Are you just using the notes api? or the CRM Action buttons?
<@U01QVR44MEY> using the notes api, I wasnt able to get the action button to functino
but sounds like that'll be the work around?
Well the action button will definitely work pretty well, but you won't be able to change the create date. you can change the create date through the api though
Just make sure you're passing the `hs_timestamp` parameter correctly, epoc milliseconds
You can also pass the owner: `HubSpot_owner_id`
that shouldnt be an issue, we just need the created_by to function. The issue I had was importing the CrmActionButton
do we import it as "CrmActionButton"
Yeah, better error messages for the account types would be very helpful
giving this a shot TY
yes of course

That did it
I was trying to import it from "@HubSpot/ui-extensions/" not "@HubSpot/ui-extensions/crm"
sick, glad I could help
